name: Gefilte Fish
author: Daisy
summary: My mother-in-law took great pains to prepare Gefilte Fish for Passover and Rosh Hashanah. The best legacy she left was to teach her sons how to do it and in turn they would teach their wives and then the next generation. This has been passed down and today it is still appreciated as the Mintz Family Gefilte Fish.
directions: Grind the fish, 2 1/2 onions and 4 carrots together
Place fish mixture in a wooden bowl
Using a hand chopper, add eggs one at a time
Add 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar, 4 teaspoons salt and white pepper and continue to chop until very well blended
Stir in the ice water a little at a time throughout this process
Add matzo meal and chop again
Check to see if mixture is thick enough to bind together to make an oval gefilte fish ball and if not add in more matzo meal
Meanwhile, fill two large heavy stock pots half full of water
Into each pot slice one raw onion and one sliced carrot
Sprinkle in paprika, salt, black pepper and two tablespoons of sugar
Bring to a boil over medium heat and let boil for 10 minutes
With wet hands shape the fish balls and carefully drop into boiling stock
Cover slightly and cook over medium-low heat for 2 hours
When done, let fish sit in the pot for 10 minutes, then remove pieces carefully to containers and strain remaining stock over fish balls, just barely covering them
They will now keep in the refrigerator for up to 6 days
